title.value: Synthetic data as an enabler for machine learning applications in medicine
title.justification: The title directly reflects the content and focus of the paper on synthetic data's role in medicine.
title.quote: Synthetic data as an enabler for machine learning applications in medicine

extractions.description: This paper discusses the role of synthetic data generation (SDG) in enabling machine learning applications in medicine. It highlights the privacy-preserving potential of synthetic data, its application across various medical fields, and the challenges and opportunities it presents for enhancing data access and sharing. The paper also explores the privacy-utility trade-offs and suggests directions for future research and policy development.

type.justification: The paper discusses the application of synthetic data in practical scenarios within medicine, involving empirical evaluations and case studies.
type.quote: This article summarizes the opportunities and challenges of SDG for health data, and provides directions for how this technology can be leveraged to accelerate data access for secondary purposes.

name.justification: The paper focuses on utilizing synthetic data in health data, addressing privacy, data sharing, and applications within the medical domain.
name.quote: Understanding the opportunity to leverage health data for innovation and care improvement has been a topic of discussion for decades.

name.justification: The paper extensively discusses the privacy aspects of synthetic data and its role in protecting patient information.
name.quote: Synthetic data does not have a one-to-one mapping to the original data or to real patients, and therefore has the potential of privacy-preserving properties.

name.justification: The paper considers synthetic data as a method for augmenting limited medical datasets.
name.quote: To address such limitations, data augmentation is a set of techniques to increase the size of a dataset without collecting and annotating more real data.

name.justification: The paper mentions federated learning as a privacy-preserving method related to synthetic data.
name.quote: Federated learning (FL) is often proposed as a privacy preserving alternative for learning algorithms while keeping the sensitive real data local.

name.justification: The paper discusses the use of generative models, such as GANs, for synthetic data creation in health applications.
name.quote: In recent years, SDG has made tremendous progress, especially from deep learning generative models.

name.justification: The paper refers to the Transversal GAN model in the context of generating 3D synthetic PET images.
name.quote: To create synthetic 3D images, we have used the Transversal GAN model.

is_contributed.justification: Transversal GAN is used within the case study but was previously established in other research.
is_contributed.quote: 3D PET image generation with tumour masks using TGAN. In SPIE Medical Imaging: Image Processing.

is_executed.justification: The paper discusses the execution of the Transversal GAN model to produce synthetic data.
is_executed.quote: To create synthetic 3D images, we have used the Transversal GAN model.

is_compared.justification: The model's outputs are compared in terms of privacy-utility trade-offs and segmentation performance.
is_compared.quote: The privacy-utility plot can be used to decide at which iteration a model has been trained enough to satisfy both privacy and utility requirements.

referenced_paper_title.value: 3D PET image generation with tumour masks using TGAN
referenced_paper_title.justification: The referenced paper for Transversal GAN is explicitly cited for its application in medical imaging.
referenced_paper_title.quote: 3D PET image generation with tumour masks using TGAN. In SPIE Medical Imaging: Image Processing.

name.justification: The paper uses the HECKTOR dataset as a basis for generating synthetic 3D PET images.
name.quote: The data to be synthesized are 3D head and neck PET images including a tumor mask based on the HECKTOR dataset.

referenced_paper_title.value: Head and neck tumor segmentation in PET/CT: the HECKTOR challenge
referenced_paper_title.justification: The paper references this study as the source for the dataset used in generating synthetic data.
referenced_paper_title.quote: Head and neck tumor segmentation in PET/CT: the HECKTOR challenge. Med. Image Anal. 77, 102336.
